message: Since we are in the KBX sandbox now, can't we alias jQuery back to "$" instead of "$K"? That way we can just copy/paste our code over from the console where we are writing it.
I haven't tried this code. In extension or bookmarklet mode $K is still necessary though unless everything will work in a sandbox in the future
I think we need a flag to know if the app is running in KBX or not
A flag for the runtime environment is a good idea.
Good idea. Maybe this can be achieved manually with something like var $ = $KOBJ.noConflict();
Because we will have to deal with sandboxes at some point, we want to keep the language (and yes, Aaron, the docs!) in sync between the two environments.
Because of the breadth of the runtime options, it will be quite some time before we have everything running in a sandbox.
You can alias back yourself via @loic's code, but it will cause issues if it's run outside the sandbox.
The other way to fix the console copy is to alias to $K into the console, (or run a kynetx app via bookmarklet to get it done for you), so that you can write to $K directly.
I use this all the timeL http://apps.kynetx.com/installable_apps/2057-$K_Injector
Thanks for the comments Sam and Alex.
The description on that app is horrible!
what does the $k injector do? (same as what description)
@TelegramSam That already exists. A flag for the runtime environment anyway. But not one that is exposed
